newsitem.title: ITALY: Rome airport passenger volume rose in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Rome airport passenger volume rose in 1996.

text.p: More than 23 million passengers passed through Rome's Fiumicino airport in 1996, 9.2 percent more than in 1995, airport management said on Monday.
Aeroporti di Roma, which is controlled by Italian state holding IRI, also said that turnover at its Fiumicino duty free shops rose 13 percent in 1996 to 120 billion lire.
Aeroporti, which also manages the capital's second airport at Ciampino, is due to be privatised fully by the end of 1998 with an initial flotation planned for early next year.
